channel.title: Tetris 25th Anniversary
channel.description:
...is today. Chosen to be the google logo instead of something in memory of D Day [and it was made by a Soviet :D]
5. Tetris was created by a Russian computer engineer named Alexey Pajitnov and released in 1985 by Nintendo. He profited very little from the game, while Nintendo, profited greatly. Perhaps that is what inspired Pajitnov's development of the game called Hatris, released in 1990. 4. The most recognizable Tetris theme music is based on the popular Russian folk song called Korobeiniki. The original is based on a poem about a young pre-revolutionary Russian haberdashery seller. The song has been covered several times, most recently by an American band called Powerglove (Nintendo nerds will not miss the reference). 3. Tetris has inspired many scholars to ask the question: Can Tetris be won? While even the best players can take it far, the conclusion of John Brzustowski, in this research project conducted while completing his M.Sc. at UBC, was no, no you can not. 2. The Tetris Effect can occur when someone plays Tetris for an extended period of time. After leaving the game, players may find themselves habitually strategizing about ways to put everyday objects together, or dream about tetrominoes while falling asleep. 1.The name Tetris is a combination of the words tetramino and tennis.
http://www.tetrisfriends.com/games/Mono/game.php

item.title: Tetris 25th Anniversary
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:21, topic:282469”][quote author=jme link=topic=373264.msg2818759#msg2818759 date=1244442800]
You guys just made me start learning it on harmonica today. But it’s hard to play I’m no good at bending notes. I can only get a bit of it sounding good.
[/quote]
Youtube it :P[/quote]

I know how it goes, but I just started learning harmonica a little while ago and haven’t learned to bend notes yet.

Read full topic

@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:15, topic:282469”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=373264.msg2816964#msg2816964 date=1244340190]

Its retarded for anyone to celebrate war related crap, unless celebrating the end. They’re okay with DDay but would be offended if this was put as the logo during 9/11

those look nothing like planes. +there is only one l.
[/quote]
The other L is behind the first L. And they don’t look nothing like planes, there is some likeness.[/quote]
in the same way mcdonalds represents a balanced diet?

Read full topic

[quote=“la­wl, post:10, topic:282469”]it was created in 1985
2009-1985 = 24

hows it 25 years ??[/quote]

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:7, topic:282469”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=373264.msg2816348#msg2816348 date=1244314656]

Anyone read the comments of people crying over how google choose to celebrate tetris instead of d-day. It’s just another example of idiot America…

  • Decides to find a Chinese man and become a Chinese citizen…

D-Day included Canada, America, and Britain; but I see your point. One must remember this is a tech world advancement.
[/quote]
I say idiot America due to the fact that majority of comments are also saying google is being anti American.[/quote]
I’m not arguing, I see your point.

Anyone read the comments of people crying over how google choose to celebrate tetris instead of d-day. It’s just another example of idiot America…

  • Decides to find a Chinese man and become a Chinese citizen…
    [/quote]
    D-Day included Canada, America, and Britain; but I see your point. One must remember this is a tech world advancement.[/quote]
    http://newsbusters.org/blogs/warner-todd-huston/2009/06/06/d-day-anniversary-google-memorializes-tetris
Because they routinely June 6, 2009 - 13:27 ET by RR GOP Because they routinely ignore American patriotic days like Memorial Day (well, except for the dinky little yellow ribbon that basically means they don't want our GIs 'over there') and ignore Christmas as a holiday, etc.

That given the Communist nature of the current regime in Washington along with the plethora of ‘czars’ being appointed by Dear Leader I’d think it was pretty obvious…the idea that Google is run by like-minded, Commie, secular-progressive individuals is pretty much a given around here.

One of the 34% who thinks George W. Bush was a great President. One of the 61% who wants to bring back the stock and pillory (yep…approval for Congress now at 39%…do you believe that!?).


I agree with Miss Silabsoft.

item.title: Tetris 25th Anniversary
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

…is today. Chosen to be the google logo instead of something in memory of D Day [and it was made by a Soviet :D]

5. Tetris was created by a Russian computer engineer named Alexey Pajitnov and released in 1985 by Nintendo. He profited very little from the game, while Nintendo, profited greatly. Perhaps that is what inspired Pajitnov's development of the game called Hatris, released in 1990.

  1. The most recognizable Tetris theme music is based on the popular Russian folk song called Korobeiniki. The original is based on a poem about a young pre-revolutionary Russian haberdashery seller. The song has been covered several times, most recently by an American band called Powerglove (Nintendo nerds will not miss the reference).

  2. Tetris has inspired many scholars to ask the question: Can Tetris be won? While even the best players can take it far, the conclusion of John Brzustowski, in this research project conducted while completing his M.Sc. at UBC, was no, no you can not.

  3. The Tetris Effect can occur when someone plays Tetris for an extended period of time. After leaving the game, players may find themselves habitually strategizing about ways to put everyday objects together, or dream about tetrominoes while falling asleep.

1.The name Tetris is a combination of the words tetramino and tennis.


http://www.tetrisfriends.com/games/Mono/game.php

Read full topic
